This code chunk is part of a comprehensive tutorial on 3D graphics programming using Panda3D, focusing on setting up a basic 3D scene with multiple cubes, applying textures, and preparing for animation. The code includes initializing the scene, camera setup, loading models and textures, creating multiple instances of a cube model, and defining an animation function to rotate the cubes over time. This chunk serves as the foundational setup before introducing more advanced topics such as shaders and texture manipulation in subsequent sections of the tutorial.

base.setBackgroundColor(0.0, 0.0, 0.0)
base.disableMouse()

base.camLens.setNearFar(1.0, 50.0)
base.camLens.setFov(45.0)

camera.setPos(0.0, -20.0, 10.0)
camera.lookAt(0.0, 0.0, 0.0)

root = render.attachNewNode("Root")
root.setPos(0.0, 0.0, 0.0)

textureArrow = loader.loadTexture("arrow.png")
textureArrow.setWrapU(Texture.WMClamp)
textureArrow.setWrapV(Texture.WMClamp)

stageArrow = TextureStage("Arrow")
stageArrow.setSort(1)

textureCircle = loader.loadTexture("circle.png")
textureCircle.setWrapU(Texture.WMClamp)
textureCircle.setWrapV(Texture.WMClamp)

stageCircle = TextureStage("Circle")
stageCircle.setSort(2)

modelCube = loader.loadModel("cube.egg")

cubes = []
for x in [-3.0, 0.0, 3.0]:
    cube = modelCube.copyTo(root)
    cube.setPos(x, 0.0, 0.0)
    cubes += [ cube ]

base.accept("escape", sys.exit)

base.accept("o", base.oobe)

def animate(t):
    for i in range(len(cubes)):
        cubes[i].setH(t * (2.0 ** i))

interval = LerpFunc(animate, 5.0, 0.0, 360.0)
